alert.note: Alert for Collin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Collin County through 315 AM CDT... At 245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Princeton, or 11 miles east of McKinney, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McKinney, Wylie, Royse City, Princeton, Melissa, Farmersville, Lowry Crossing, Lavon, Blue Ridge, Nevada, Josephine, New Hope, Westminster, Altoga, Copeville, Frognot, and Lavon Lake. This includes Interstate 30 near mile marker 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
